alert.note: Alert for New Haven (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 2:56AM EST until January 10 at 7:24PM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in New York NY has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Connecticut... Naugatuck River near Beacon Falls affecting New Haven County. For the Naugatuck River...including Beacon Falls...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Naugatuck River near Beacon Falls. * WHEN...From early this morning to this evening. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Flooding begins in the upstream towns of Waterbury and Naugatuck. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:46 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 12.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 12.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:46 AM EST Wednesday was 12.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate above flood stage with a maximum value of 12.2 feet this morning. It will fall below flood stage this morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.2 feet on 04/23/2006. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 am EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Naugatuck River Beacon Falls 12.0 12.1 Wed 2 am EST 8.6 7.3 6.7 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 300 PM EST.
